intro: Erysimum officinale, commonly known as yellow wallflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic of the mustard family. Its leaves are elongated and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Erysimum officinale is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional medicine.
